div.head: CHAP. XXXIII.
1 God is to be praysed for his goodnesse, 6 for his power, 12 and for his prouidence. 20 Confidence is to be placed in God.
div.ab: Reioyce in the Lord, O yee righteous: for prayse is comely for the vpright.
Praise the Lord with harp: sing vnto him with the Psalterie, and an instrument of ten strings.
Sing vnto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.
For the word of the Lord is right: and all his workes are done in trueth.
Hee loueth righteousnesse and iudgement: the earth is ful of the goodnesse of the Lord. Psal. 119. 64. , Or, mercy.
By the word of the Lord were the heauens made: and all the host of them, by the breath of his mouth. Gen. 1.6. & 7.
He gathereth the waters of the sea together, as an heape: he layeth vp the depth in storehouses.
Let all the earth feare the Lord: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
For he spake, and it was done: he commanded, and it stood fast.
The Lord bringeth the counsell of the heathen to nought: he maketh the deuices of the people, of none effect. Esa. 19. 3. , Heb. maketh frustrate.
The counsaile of the Lord standeth for euer, the thoughts of his heart to all generations. Prou. 19. 21. Esa.46.10. , Heb. to generation and generation.
Blessed is the nation, whose God is the Lord: and the people, whom he hath chosen for his owne inheritance. Psal.65.4 & 144. 15.
The Lord looketh from heauen: he beholdeth all the sonnes of men.
From the place of his habitation, he looketh vpon all the inhabitants of the earth.
He fashioneth their hearts alike: he considereth all their workes.
There is no king saued by the multitude of an hoste: a mightie man is not deliuered by much strength.
An horse is a vaine thing for safetie: neither shall he deliuer any by his great strength.
Behold, the eye of the Lord is vpon them that feare him: vpon them that hope in his mercy: Iob.36.7. & 34.14. 1.Pet.3.12.
To deliuer their soule from death, and to keepe them aliue in famine.
Our soule waiteth for the Lord: he is our helpe, and our shield.
For our heart shall reioyce in him: because we haue trusted in his holy name.
Let thy mercy (O Lord) be vpon vs: according as we hope in thee.
